decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Nomads en-Kor, Cephalid Illusionist, and Dread Return to mill the library and win with Thassa's Oracle or Nadu, Winged Wisdom. It uses recursive effects like Narcomoeba and Memory's Journey to continue the combo, while also utilizing control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and flexibility in finding the combo pieces. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently, leveraging its synergies to outpace and outmaneuver opponents.

The main concept of this Cephalid Breakfast Legacy deck is to quickly assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill your library, triggering Narcomoeba and eventually Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. It focuses on utilizing various spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's gameplay. This deck also includes versatile cards like Urza's Saga and Voice of Victory to further enhance the combo potential and increase the overall consistency of the strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through taxing effects and disruptive creatures like Thalia, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Barrowgoyf and Gloomfang Mauler. The deck utilizes powerful removal like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board, while also having ways to quickly reanimate threats with Reanimate. The deck also has some control elements with cards like Opposition Agent and Sheoldred's Edict. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Combo - Hogaak deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Vengevine, Gravecrawler, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, then use Altar of Dementia to sacrifice creatures and mill cards to bring them back and generate value. The deck also includes cards like Bridge from Below and Carrion Feeder to take advantage of sacrificing creatures. The goal is to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and combos to win the game in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with aggressive Human creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Kitesail Freebooter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The key strategy is to buff up your creatures with Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to overwhelm your opponent and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while disruptive lands like Karakas and Wasteland help control the board. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, disruptive, and overwhelming in order to outpace and outlast the opponent.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to utilize a variety of powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outlast and outmaneuver opponents. The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage and setting up powerful win conditions. Cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Lórien Revealed provide additional card advantage and selection, while threats like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage offer ways to pressure the opponent and close out the game. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and outplaying opponents to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands that have powerful effects, such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combination to create a 20/20 indestructible creature. By constantly recurring lands with Life from the Loam and Winding Way, the player can generate a steady stream of resources. Crop Rotation and Expedition Map allow for quick access to key lands like Bojuka Bog or Karakas. Wasteland and Blast Zone help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Maze of Ith and Malevolent Rumble provide additional protection. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through land synergy and resource advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while creating a powerful board presence. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Exploration, and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly assemble powerful combinations like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale to slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient land interactions and strategic resource management.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's resources with Wasteland and efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It aims to generate value and card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, while utilizing the Life from the Loam engine to recur key lands and maintain consistency. The deck can tutor for specific lands with Crop Rotation and Urza's Saga, creating powerful synergies and establishing a dominant board presence over time.

This UWx Control deck focuses on controlling the game through countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Terminus. The deck utilizes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for answers, while also having access to powerful cards like Force of Will and Snapcaster Mage for additional flexibility. The inclusion of Lórien Revealed and Forth Eorlingas! provides extra protection and value, making it a versatile and resilient control archetype in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo using cards like Helm of Obedience, Leyline of the Void, and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win the game. The deck utilizes efficient disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress along with powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board. With the use of powerful tutors like Profane Tutor, the deck can efficiently find the combo pieces and close out the game with a powerful finish. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Dark Confidant for card advantage and Lotus Petal for ramp.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost evasive creatures, such as Ornithopter and Baleful Strix, paired with powerful Ninja cards like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to control the game, along with card draw and selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces. The deck aims to apply consistent pressure while generating card advantage through Ninjitsu abilities and out-tempoing the opponent.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor, Ocelot Pride, and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The deck aims to control the game with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze while using cards like Swords to Plowshares to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach and a way to close out games if the board becomes stalled. Overall, the deck focuses on applying early pressure and maintaining control throughout the game.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling and resolving a game-ending threat, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier, by using powerful cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces, as well as card selection and acceleration in the form of Brainstorm, Ponder, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck aims to win the game through a fast and explosive combo while maintaining control over the game through interaction and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a massive advantage. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to provide additional utility and card advantage. The mana base is designed to provide a good balance between colored sources and utility lands like Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bring them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. Using counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive cards like Daze, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide additional threats and value to keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes a combination of reanimation and disruptive elements to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows for explosive plays and the ability to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes disruption and protection with cards like Force of Will and Daze to ensure the combo can go off without interference.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and slow down their game plan. With efficient removal and countermagic, this deck aims to control the game until it can win with its threats like Murktide Regent.
